description: Safety CLI 3 - Vulnerability Scanning for Secure Python Development. Leverage the most comprehensive vulnerability data available to secure your projects against vulnerable and malicious packages.

options.name: --stage
options.description: Assign a development lifecycle stage to your scan (default: development). This labels the scan and its findings in Safety Platform with this stage.

options.name: --key
options.description: The API key required for cicd stage or production stage scans. For development stage scans unset the API key and authenticate using safety auth. Tip: can also be set using the environment variable SAFETY_API_KEY.

options.name: --proxy-host
options.description: Specify a proxy host for network communications. Note: proxy details can be set globally in a config file (see safety configure --help).

options.name: --proxy-port
options.description: Set the proxy port (default: 80). Requires --proxy-host. Note: proxy details can be set globally.

options.name: --proxy-protocol
options.description: Choose the proxy protocol (default: https). Requires --proxy-host. Note: proxy details can be set globally.

options.name: --disable-optional-telemetry
options.description: Opt-out of sending optional telemetry data. Anonymized telemetry data will remain.

options.name: --debug
options.description: Enable debug mode for detailed output.

auth.description: Authenticate Safety CLI to perform scans. Your default browser will automatically open to https://platform.safetycli.com.

alert.description: [deprecated] Create GitHub pull requests or GitHub issues using a `safety check` json report file. Being replaced by newer features.

check.description: [deprecated] Find vulnerabilities at target files or environments. Now replaced by safety scan, and will be unsupported beyond 1 May 2024.

check-updates.description: Check for version updates to Safety CLI.

configure.description: Set up global configurations for Safety CLI, including proxy settings and organization details.

generate.description: Generate a boilerplate Safety CLI policy file for customized security policies. Note: Safety Platform policies will override any local policy files found.

license.description: [deprecated] Find licenses at target files or environments. This command will be replaced by safety scan, and will be unsupported beyond 1 May 2024.

validate.description: Verify that a local policy file is valid. NAME is the name of the file type to validate. Valid values are: policy_file.
